benefits.description: Benefits are feature highlights with a heading and detailed content explaining why customers should choose this service. They appear as card-style sections with icons.

heading.description: Short, punchy benefit title (e.g., 'Licensed & Certified Technicians', 'Fast Response Times')

content.description: Detailed paragraph explaining the benefit, typically 2-4 sentences with specific details and value propositions

example.heading: Built for Tomorrow's Connected Home
example.content: We design networks ready for the next generation: Cat6a cabling supporting multi-gig internet, Wi-Fi 6E access points with PoE++ power, whole-home automation integration, and AV distribution to multiple zones...

offerings.description: Specific services or deliverables included in this service offering. Displayed as a bulleted checklist with checkmarks. Each offering is a complete sentence or phrase describing one specific item/service.

item_length.description: Each offering should be a complete, descriptive sentence (not just 2-3 words). Examples: 'Whole-home structured cabling design with centralized equipment rack', 'On-site load calculations per CEC/NEC Article 220'

example: Whole-home structured cabling design with centralized equipment rack and distributed access points
Cat6a home runs to offices, bedrooms, living areas, and detached structures for multi-gig performance
Fire-rebuild technology infrastructure coordination from framing through final inspection
offerings.note: Not all service pages have offerings lists. Some pages only have benefits sections. This is normal and acceptable.

faqs.description: Frequently asked questions specific to this service and location. Questions should be customer-focused and answers should be detailed, helpful, and location-specific.

question.description: Customer question in natural language, often starting with 'How', 'What', 'Do I need', 'Can you', etc.

answer.description: Detailed answer with specific information, often mentioning location-specific details, code requirements, timelines, or processes. Typically 3-5 sentences.

example.question: Do I need permits in Altadena for home network and AV wiring?
example.answer: For existing homes, pure low-voltage data/AV cabling often doesn't require LA County permits. However, new electrical circuits for equipment racks, in-wall TV power, outdoor electrical for landscape AV, or any work involving structural penetrations will trigger permit requirements through the Altadena Building and Safety office...
